description: I wasn't going to do a review but I feel like they deserve more than the 3.5 stars that they have on Yelp. Walked in at 7:40 on a Friday with an order for 6 drinks and the barrista whipped all the drinks out fast without giving us grief and they were made nicely. I like that the drinks aren't overly sweet. Peets is much much better than Starbucks and this location isn't an exception. The only thing that caught my attention was that the vanilla cardamom latte didn't really taste like cardamom. But it may just be the amount of spice mixed in that blend. FYI they have soy, coconut, and almond milk sub for milk
author: Rou M.

description: Came here the other day after waking up in West Portal with boy. I got a vanilla latte and a chocolate croissant. It was a fun morning activity.
author: Denise C.

description: I like Peet's Coffee and it is very consistent at almost all locations. I did not like much the selection of their bake goods. I paid $1.50 for hard boiled egg. Overall the service was good and the coffee was great.
author: Juan V.

description: It's been a year since my last review which I gave Peet's coffee a 4 star.  Everything is pretty much the same, coffee is consistent with other Peet's Coffee and it's not burnt from sitting around too long. It's also a very sociable atmosphere.  It's a much older crowd when I usually stop by here in mornings.  Most people seem to know each other.  I'm upping it to 5 stars b/c I saw one of the employees help one of the patrons out to their car.  I rarely see people go out of their way to help others but this employee did.  So, if you're in west Portal this is the coffee place to go to.  Your only options are Starbucks and Toast.  See Toast for a review on their establishment.
author: Mike S.

description:
Insanely rude. Walk in at 7:15pm and ask for a mild coffee. Snarky dude with glasses behind counter tells me it's going to be at least "5 mins or longer".  Yeah whatever so just give me anything. Another guy in line tells me snarky was completely ignoring him so it wasn't just me.

Insult to injury - I'm sitting outside at a table enjoying my purchased snack box and coffee when snarky starts to move the tables inside at 7:48. I know they are open till 8 and ask him if he needs the table. He states "yes we need the tables inside now". So I'm trying to pack up my snack box, coffee and manage my elderly dog as this dude lifts everything around me. Never again. I'll spend my $$$ elsewhere. Dude get another job. Customer service is not your gig and you make Pete's look bad.
author: Kenneth S. L.

description: I made a special trip to this store to buy a pound of coffee. I got there at 7:42 PM and they were closed, even though their sign, website, Google etc. said they were open until 8 PM. Look, if you tell people you are open until  8 PM STAY OPEN UNTIL 8 PM, don't make people make unnecessary trips.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Best coffee shop and all of us up! Super friendly staff. Have no idea why it's a 4 store for others. 
Gal from behind the counter just stepped out and gave me a hug just because
author: Diane D.

description: Ok it gets busy but it's not a reason to be rude to customers. Also when I pay $4.00 for a coffee I expect it to be good. I ended up with a latte with no foam. I choose Peet's over Starbucks because of the quality but I got really disappointed today. Oh and no table available inside and outside.
author: Oxana B.

description:
Good service, excellent coffee been coming to this location since it opened.
However pastries allways taste like day old and had the hot sandwiches today
Had something with sausage some kinda  flat bread tried couple items in the past, not good
Yek unless you are starving. I rather go to McDonald's for breakfast items much better
And cheaper .
Place is declining in service to customers 
Usually there early morning weekdays, evening manager very nice
author: Sergei Z.

description: My favorite peets in SF! Been coming here for a few years now and my experience has always been positive. The restrooms are fairly clean and wifi is super fast. My go to working coffee shop in west portal.
author: Anna H.

description: West Portal  Peet's, once again, demonstrates a swollen lack of customer service:  "Hey guys, you close at eight or nine?" The fear evidenced in the eyes of some scaredy bunnies and one stoic wabbit divulged sufficiently. I decided to let that one slide. "So what's today's brew?"  followed. But of course the response was unintelligible the second time around, besides which merely repeating the Peet's coffee's name without anything descriptive like, "it's a rich bodied, medium roast which works well with cream and perhaps a tasty snack." When it's a really slooow late afternoon/early evening further demonstrates a lack of caring. But aside from these managerial oversights, the WiFi connection there appears problematic. Nevertheless, hearing a staff member's declarative "It works for me!" fails to assist. My questioning to have the WiFi's server rebooted was met with its high-up location's description, and nothing more. Now then...what must one do to perhaps re-accommodate oneself to perhaps obtain a refill and another baked item...? So I thanked the ethers in the room and departed...
author: Joe C.

description:
My last few experiences at this location are questionable.   What's the question?   First of all,  the place is clean and the coffee is consistent. 

(The following had been removed as the issue has been settled.  I'm pleased that this not ignored.  It tells me that Peets on a corporate level has the class that it portrays.  

That being said,  "water under the Golden Gate Bridge".
author: Miguel C.

description:
Convienant location.

Customer service : fine.

My hot chocolate was exceptionally good.

Parking: ok.
author: Bert K.

description:
I LOVE Peet's coffee! Probably one of my favorite ones in SF because of it's cozy feel. It's smaller than other Peet's I've seen but the drinks are still at its best.

Service is great here! All the workers are super friendly! Tried their white mocha, black tie, chocolate hazelnut mocha, matcha latte, caramel macchiato, javavivas, etc. and never been disappointed. I also love their pumpkin bread during the holidays or their petite scones! Their bathroom is super clean too.

Only downside of this location: no power outlets. I've wanted to use my laptop (with horrible battery life) but I guess they only encourage reading and/or coffee over conversation here.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
I called 45 minutes before I needed my order to give them enough time to make one coffee traveler and a dozen pastries for a meeting I had that morning.  When I arrived and asked for my order the cashier had no idea what I was talking about so he asked the manager, Allison, about it. 

The manager had taken the order but forgot to make it.  She made no attempt at apologizing just slowly started to get the traveler box together.  I asked her how long it would take and she said about 10 minutes, which I did not have. 

I told her I was disappointed in the service and would now be without treats for my meeting- again, no apology, nothing.  I walked out.  

I've had so many bad experiences with the staff at Peet's across the Bay Area and am wondering who does the hiring and training.  Whoever it is needs to work on training the staff at customer service techniques that make customers want to come back!
author: Michelle C.

description:
This location is so close to my house, but I've had so many bad espresso drinks (undrinkable) that I take lyft all the way to the Castro location. Last time I was at the West Portal location, the shift manager stopped the barrista in the middle of making my drink, saying, "No, don't do it that way." She then looked at me and said, "I'll make your drink next time." She should have remade that one herself. Never been comped for a single bad drink here.
 
Seriously, the kids at this location probably don't even drink espresso. They probably drink that bubble gum pink crap at Starbucks. 

Note to Peets: I don't want to waste 20 mins on the phone with you for a single drink comp. TRAIN YOUR STAFF! IF SOMEONE DOESN'T DRINK ESPRESSO, DON'T MAKE THEM A BARRISTA. Examples of Peet's location where the barristas know what they're doing...Castro location, Mission and 3rd.
author: Lynn B.

description:
This is the only Peet's that I found that cares about the environment enough to have their used coffee prepackaged for customers to just grab and go. 

Not 5 stars due to the no handicap access that makes it very difficult for wheelchairs and strollers to come in without help.
author: M C.

description: Great coffee better then Starbucks. which is so over rated. Peets has a better and deeper taste in their coffee by the way they roast their coffee beans.
author: Andrew M.

description: It's really a hit or miss. Some of the baristas are super talented and make drinks that are way better than in fancy coffee shops. But I've gotten a few really badly made drinks here.
author: Elina P.

description: I love this peets in West Portal. The service is fast and great and the coffee is so flavorful. Just went in today and it was a wonderful experience.
author: Steph L.

description: I remember I used to come to this location years ago just for sweet Hot Cocoa! Sometimes I'd buy a cup, go home and write! Chocolate has its advantages!
author: Julio B.

description:
I had bought a couple of gift cards at the Stonestown store but they were out of those little gift envelopes there, so when I was at West Portal, I stopped here to see if they had them.

I walked in and went right to the counter which had no line and see two people having a personal conversation behind the counter five feet away from me; one a male obviously an employee and the other either his friend, girlfriend or more likely an off duty employee dressed in regular clothes who had finished a shift and was leaving. the girl in regular clothes was facing me and could see me standing there at the counter for what seemed like longer but probably two or three minutes; which is way too long if she was an employee and knew someone was waiting at the counter. she leaves and the the barista guy turns to the sink without even looking over at the counter and starts cleaning equipment and he either finally notices me or maybe I said "excuse me" and turns to me, seems friendly and all, but I explained that I needed a couple of gift card envelopes and he grabs one with his soaking wet hands; can't remember if he was wearing gloves or not and nicely hands it to me. it's all wet and I'm thinking "uh right, thanks, this is for a gift" when he turned away I just reached behind the register where he had grabbed that one and took two dry ones and left.

End of my experience with this store. I gave this review two stars because I like other Peet's stores and their coffee and I don't want to give this whole store the lowest possible rating based on just having walked in for a few minutes, not trying their coffee and one silly experience, but I will add that if the girl in regular clothing was an off duty employee, there is simply no excuse for not telling her co worker that there was someone waiting at the register as she was facing me and saw me standing there for at least two minutes and then just walked out. Even if she was not an employee, that was extremely rude and thoughtless of her.
author: David A.

description:
LOVE Peet's!  

It's the first time we went to this location. A bit tiny but very cozy! They got my Med Cinnamon Hazelnut Almond Milk Latte perfect - and very HOT the way I like it!

I'm so glad we found this Peet's in West Portal - while Peet's is a big Brand - the atmosphere in this location is very cozy and neighborhood like.  Service was great and personable.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Best peets in town with the best staff in town, I am talking about you Michael, Allison, Allen and Valarie. They are super friendly and professional, always have great recommendations and they make the best drinks.
author: Yazan Z.

description:
Could not stop thinking about my delicious vanilla latte I received last week I made another trip. I went in the afternoon and the store was much easier to maneuver through. The morning is overly congested of people trying to run in and out, it's hard to not be in someone's way. On to the vanilla latte round 2. This time maybe I got my hopes up to high or maybe it's the new guy behind the counter learning how to make
my drink for the first time ;( My drink did not have the vanilla flavor well balanced with the strong espresso coffee bitter notes. Sad me =( I guess it really depends who's pouring your drink.
author: Liz N.

description: all the people that work at this location are amazing and super polite, however every time I get a drink there it tastes like shit. my iced lattes are basically half melted ice end it usually tastes burnt. also the layout in here is horrible, and I think it's stress is the employees
author: B G.

description: Bought a coffee free vanilla javiva lik I almost always do and it had a weird coco powder after taste so I brought it back wondering if it contained coffee but the barista who made it ensured that it only had milk.  They're not the cheapest drinks in the world so I was a bit disappointed because I don't want to waste my money but the aftertaste is hard to get past. I didn't want to insist for them to remake it but I wish they had, I was really looking forward to it too. Oh well maybe next time, I will come back again, service is nice, still recommend.
author: Alison C.

description: Very Stale Almond Croissants!!! Latte was tasty and beautiful yesterday (Sunday) and barista was delightful but the almond croissant was at least 3 days old, what a disappointment- cardboard with almonds. Avoid the pastry- looks good but thats all!
author: Allyson B.

description:
This Peet's is incredibly busy.  Parking is nonexistent though you may get lucky if you park a few blocks away.  Every spot in that congested area on West Portal is metered anyway. The interior is odd shaped.  There is more room for the baristas behind the counter then there is for patrons who would like to sit.
Coffee is as strong as ever--and service is fine.
author: Thomas D.

description:
They have great coffee! If your in west portal go here! You will really like the service ! I love it very much lol ! Ok have a nice day,tyyl . Gotta go ok good bye ..:) 
Yup! You want more ? Ok. I really like Pete's coffee  
Is that better ?
author: Stavros N.

description:
Great staff here, so much nicer than when I used to pop in.  Very helpful and you can tell a lot of the regulars know the staff.  I was browsing for a gift and sitting in the table next to the tins of tea was a SFSU college freshman who popped up to ask if I needed assistance. She wasn't even working there!  She told me she works at the Stonestown Peet's store and was sitting there with her laptop, SFSU sweatshirt and jeans.
She helped me decide on the tin of tea and thermos. What a nice Peet's employee.

I told the Peet's WP employee about what this young girl did and she told me she was meeting with the mgr of the Peet's Stonestown the next day and would tell the mgr about her.  
I bought a $25 gift card and got a free latte for the purchase. Very good coffee and not upsetting to my stomach.  I'll have to make a point to stop in here more often than the SBs down the street.
author: Ry T.

description:
I only drink Peet's when I need more pep in my day...I mean when I really feel sluggish.

This Peet's remind me of the one at Greenbrae, where Baristas pay attention....really pay attention. I am not one of those who orders...Skinny Machiatto with a little bit of this and a drizzle of that...I just want medium coffee and that's it..and easy as it may sound there are Barista's still who effs it up....but not this one.

Keep up the good work everyone....its good when Barista smiles too.
author: Malou C.

description: Not only are all the drinks here amazing (matcha latte, mocha, black tie, specialty holiday drinks like pumpkin lattes etc) but the staff is always extremely friendly. This is my favorite Peets location. Many of the regulars here have formed lasting friendships in this cozy and friendly atmosphere over perfect cups of coffee. It is a must try for fast and wonderful service.
author: Shannon C.

description: I love going to Peets because the coffee isn't as strong as starbucks in my opinion. The chai tea is my favorite because it has a slight taste of cinnamon but it's not so over whelming. The Jaimie lime cooler is refreshing with a green tea taste at the end and the berry pomegranate is sweeter with more like a black tea taste to it. I personally really like going to Peets after getting a coupon.
author: Sul L.

description:
I walked by seeing a sign on their window with the pumpkin spice latte. Perfect timing for this item since there are 37 days until Halloween. I am glad I came in for a cup of Large Pumpkin Latte today. I am craving for another cup of pumpkin latte as I write up this review.

Peet's Coffee & Tea is on my list of coffee shops to go to for a cup of coffee. I came in here today and ordered one of the seasonal beverages on the coffee menu. The beverage I ordered today was a Large Pumpkin Latte with soy milk. Good first experience here!

Today, I was craving for a cup of large pumpkin latte with soy milk so I came in to Peet's. I did like that my pumpkin latte was ready for pickup in just 10 minutes. Oh, I like how my large pumpkin latte came out perfectly flavored. If getting coffee before heading to school or work is part of your morning rituals, Peet's Coffee & Tea is your answer.

Some of the staff members are friendly and polite. This coffee shop did look clean inside. Overall, I had a good experience here.
author: Bennett W.

description:
Nice place to grab a drink, but there's also a Starbucks kiosk inside! 
This peet's is fairly new. It's right next to chipotle. Since it's at a mall, parking might be a bit tricky. It always seems to be a bit busy whenever I pass by, so the drinks must be worth it, right? 
The matchata is great.
author: Jade F.

description:
update: it's been remodeled, with an expanded workspace; counters are lowered (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tLCTn1IMu1qUX3JAWxmf_g?select=eK54al6jUKeNJVA_iUVMcA).

If you spend $25 for a Peet's gift card, you get a free any-size drink.

The other Peet's visit's latte was good, so two days later I had to go to this Peet's and grabbed another. Inviting with not that many, but enough indoor and outdoor seating.

Located on West Portal Ave; a real "SF-local" neighborhood, and can see the WP-MUNI station from here. Mostly metered parking in the area. A good place to stop in before, or after, the Stern Grove Festival's Sunday Concerts. Since discovering their lattes, now will have to alternate between this Peet's and the StBux down the block (http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=09T1oyi6c-9lvyt7gQCD2w&q=starbucks+west).

Bonus review: "Public Enemies" = Good history lesson about 1930's mobsters, and the background story on the formation of the FBI. It's another M.Mann movie that is somewhat sympathetic to the bad guys, with at times fun dialogue - pretty much a theme in all his movies (my three copies of various formats of "Heat" can attest). J.Depp was cool as J.Dillinger.
author: Peter L.

description:
I LOVE Peet's Coffee so much I want to take it behind the middle school and get it pregnant. I especially LOVE this Peet's Coffee. Peet's is great in providing an experience that is full of character and individualism, does not feel like part of a franchise. West Portal Peet's excels in this department. The staff is friendly, adorable and really great, the coffee is always fantastic and the setting is wonderful. I love this place. 

There is more seating at  Starbuck's in West Portal but Starbuck's coffee is in the upper echelons of suckage so Peet's it is !
author: Aud S.

description:
You would think there's not much difference between one Peet's and the next, right? And in principle, there is not. But this Peet's has a random assortment of staff, some of which are more competent and friendly than others. 

I find that a few of the baristas/cashiers in particular to be really condescending. I can't explain it exactly, but the way that they serve the coffee makes it seem like they are doing you a great favor in so doing. It's kind of irritating, and I am crabby enough before I get my caffeine without having to be irritated by a condescending barista. In addition, there's a lot of variation in how they make the drinks. I've been to this Peet's and gotten a perfect nonfat cappuccino (right amount of froth, right temperature, etc.) But there were several other times when the cappuccino was drowning in milk, like a latte. Other times when it was bone dry and I had to get them to remake the drink. Other times when they used the wrong type of milk when I had specifically asked for fat free.

Sure, making a drink incorrectly could happen at any establishment, including a Starbucks. However, my drink has been inconsistent many more times at this particular Peet's location than at any of the other Starbucks or Peet's that I frequent. I imagine that this is because the waitstaff turns over too fast, they don't get to learn the drinks well enough.

Come here for the coffee, not for the staff. And if your drink isn't perfect, get them to remake it.
author: John S.

description:
I think they chose the wrong location, the doorway is kind of hard to get in and out of because of the way things are setup inside.  The place seems long, crowded and too small.  But who cares... what about the coffee?

I went there today (it was my second visit, I went last week also) and got a large iced-Americano again, and once again it was perfect and delicious.  Friendly staff.  I'm becoming a regular.  =)
author: Cynthia B.

description: Nice staff, I asked Alan to make me a beverage "the way you'd made it for yourself." Good conversation, great coconut latte.
author: Connor P.

description:
Good coffee, but not one power outlet. 

You would think that trendy coffee shops that make business on people sipping 3.00 coffees, would have enough common sense to install at least one power outlet for their customers, but...

Why spend extra money on electricity bills when you don't have to.  


Shame...
author: Tim D.

description:
First word to customers; as a person with barista experience, if you're going to talk loudly on your cell phone about how your friends daughter either committed suicide or died of a seizure, don't you dare ask the barista to let the foam settle for you. You're just extending the amount of time everyone these has to listen to your drama, which none of us do.

Anyway, two stars; I ordered a sweetened iced matcha green tea latte. It came out unsweetened and tasting like just milk poured over ice, so the matcha was way too weak. The hot ones always come out delicious so I thought I'd try it iced; I guess they didn't increase the proportions of sweetener for an iced drink. Anyway I was not interested in finishing it.
author: Cieleau S.

description:
HOLD the coupon printing! 
All you have to do is flash your coupon from your phone or mention it to them and you will get that BOGO that's going on right now. 
exp: 01/18/11
http://www.peets.com/retailoffer/default.asp?rdir=1&cm_mmc=retailemail*11.01.07_bev_bogo*retail*coupon_btn

Peet's website also has special offers too!
http://www.peetscoffee.com/special_offers/

Soy Latte is crispy and that White Chocolate Mocha is not as sweet at Starbu*ks but it's getting there. My taste buds are getting snappier! Still love it though.

Need to mention that this place closes pretty early too. I think 8pm.
author: Jess W.

description:
I still think starbucks has better coffee, but you gotta spread the love.

Ever since I started drinking my coffee regular (no cream) you can taste the flavors 500% better.

For better or for worse, I am a snoody coffee sipping San Franciscan. I can feel the South Park episode any minute.

Decent seating with a couple of spots outside. 

I really like the staff, props.
author: Brendan C.

description: I'm a big fan of Peet's. I've built enough of an attachment with the brand that whenever I see a Peet's I just walk straight in without hesitation. Which is what I did with this particular Peet's when I was in the West Portal area. And like always, I ended up getting a Mocha, which was rich, flavorful and dependable. There was a cute, cozy, family-like atmosphere here on a Sunday morning. It seemed like many of the patrons were regulars based on the way they were chatting with the baristas which made me feel like an outsider. Lol. There are a few good seats by the window and a couple outside, but apart from that, it's not a spacious, "let me set up my station and start working on my next project" coffee shop. It's more like a "let me read a newspaper, chit-chat for a bit and leave" kind of a place.
author: Srivatsan S.

description:
Your coffee sucks but your Matcha is great! 

So my only problem with Peets is that they buy all these amazing coffees yet they ruin all of them because they have a thing for over roasting! What a shame. Every time I drink their coffee I can't help but get massive stomach aches that last for a few hours. 

Their matcha on the other hand is actually some of the best matcha that I have ever had. When I order it though I have to get it unsweetened because I hate sugary drinks. Matcha is not even supposed to be sweetened in the first place! Americans just seem to have this weird fatty knack to adding sugary into every possible edible thing. So make sure when you order it to try it without all the sugar and additives.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
I walked by this place first and saw a handful of people getting coffee. Then I went to Starbucks down the street. It was a line out the door with a ton of people using laptops to freeload on internet. I was debating if I should stand in a long line or.. I ran back to Peet's. 

The staff were really friendly, cheerful and made my mocha in a few minutes. I'm glad I didn't stand in line at Starbucks. I think the line just never moves every time I walk past. 

I got a medium Cafe Mocha, added a shake of sugar and 2 sprinkles of cocoa. Sat at a corner table, drank my mid morning brew and relaxed to some some classical music playing from my iPod. It's been a long week and I needed to clear my brain of crap and I was waiting for a friend to go to lunch with. 

Woosaaaaah.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Not just their coffee, but I also like the folks who works here. The staff are really nice especially to my friend, Camille who takes forever to get her money out lol. The place is a bit small, but I don't mind. I am just there for good coffee and excellent service. 
Large americano to go please.

Ciao!
author: Po S.

description: It's always a good sign when companies listen to customer feedback, hopefully things will be better if I visit again.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Peet's = God's gift to coffee. 

Please do yourself a favor and stop here if you're in San Francisco or the vicinity as opposed to another ubiquitous coffee chain that's sure to also be close by. 

The coffee here is actual, robust coffee...not the drivel you get from the lady in green. 

Yes, it's expensive to get coffee shop coffee all the time so all I can say is treat yourself once in a while and make your own at home the rest of the time. 

Peet's is definitely a San Francisco (area) treat!
author: ciara c.

description: Coffee is extremely important to me. Yes, places like Blue Bottle are excellent, but in my opinion Peets roasts the best beans in the world.
author: Michael S.

description:
What has happened to PEETS?

  As a fan of Peets Coffee from the early 70's in Berkeley, CA. I am shocked at the coffee served at this Peets on West Portal.   At first taste, I thought my weak coffee, (I know, weak coffee at Peets?)  was do to the fact I asked for nonfat milk in a mocha latte.  I turned it back in and asked for a regular latte with regular milk. It also was  WEAK!  

Peets used to be my favorite coffee because they put 2 shots of expresso in their lattes.  Well, no more, my friends, these lattes are weaker than a competitor down the street.  The coffees are watered down.  And still cost $3.50!!!

Skip this place and walk a half block and get much better lattes.
author: Jacki F.

description:
Haven't been in a Peets in awhile, but happy to say still great coffee in a great neighborhood.  My girlfriend and I came this afternoon and we both had the peppermint mocha holiday espresso drink.  What a difference from the Starbucks' version.

This peppermint mocha had a caffeine kick to it.  Reinforced that it really is about the coffee; then about the fou fou dressing.

Several tables up by the window facing the street, and a nice bench further in.  And as with any coffee shop, an unisex restroom.

Espresso drinks are ordered at the register up front, and whole beans are handled at the register in the back.

Great selection of teas which is what sets Peets from places like Starbucks and Tully's.

As we sat on the bench near the back, we observed a steady stream of  customers buying whole coffee beans.

The only con - sharing the bench with a man who attempted to give us a sermon about God.  And he looked so normal.  But then, what's normal?
author: Shirley N.

description: Picture explains it all. They need to train their baristas here. For $4.20 soy latte?
author: Sam S.

description: Nothing else obvious on the street as a place for good coffee. This one has a narrow seating layout, and is often busy except late in the day. Staff is nice but varies from time to time. With lots of traffic probably needs to wipe down tables and sweep floors more often. Wifi available.
author: Boris C.

description:
It goes without saying that if you're going to do a chain coffee place, it's best if you go with Peet's.
It's a richer and stronger coffee than some other chains out there and I also remember reading somewhere they have their origins from around here.  So they're kinda local.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peet%27s_Coffee_&_Tea

But this review isn't really about the everyday coffee they serve.
It's more about their Pumpkin Spice Lattes you'll find only during the holiday season.

I was under the assumption that a tasty latte or mocha also meant an equally good Pumpkin Spice Latte.
I was wrong.
In an odd way, the same quality espresso I so appreciate was unable to render itself to the flavors of nutmeg, cinnamon, and oh yeah, Pumpkin.  Sadness.
The thing is it's not their fault.  I can only assume the Pumpkin Spice syrup they use needs a lighter and not so robust espresso to properly marry the flavors together.

You know what that means: I'm going to have test my theory out at the infamous other coffee chain.
author: Dan B.

description:
This place was a loud, crazy mad house on Saturday morning. I had to get my coffee and wait outside till the rest in my party had received their orders. I simply couldn't take it. Loud music, loud staff calling out orders, loud customers...Maybe just turn the music down a scosh...?

I came here to do business, but it was so loud we ended up turning our coffee shop / baked goodies meeting into a lunch meeting over at El Toreador. Peet's is a coffee shop, it's Saturday morning...it's supposed to be a chill/mellow/not-so-frikkin-loud, amiright?

Still, I'd rather go here than the Starbucks down the street any day.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
I haven't decided if this location or the Laurel Village one is worst. They're both chock full of yuppie douchebags. 

Yes, I drink coffee. No, I am not 16. I am in my twenties and I have a full-time job thank you very much. I needs my coffee in the morning during election week, and shortly after. 

I do not, however need your SLOW ASS SERVICE! Come on!!!!!! I've worked at a  Peet's, i've freaking barrista'ed for years. It does not take 10 mins to get me a small coffee with room for cream and a cup of tea. Sometimes I wonder if the majority of the staff knows how to multi-task but I saw that they do one drink...at a time...slowly.. 

I used to live near this yuppie douchebag neighborhood. I'm so glad I don't anymore, because if I did i'd be frequenting this location by default. 

*shudder* 

I'm going to stick to my Castro and Potrero Hill locations. At least I might see a porn star at the Castro one. Or perhaps one morning a guy will hit on my boyfriend. Who knows. Either way, it'll be entertaining.
author: Susy C.

description:
Better than Starbuck's drinks.  

That's all ya need to know!
author: Fannie S.

description:
Update: Maybe it was a bad patch  last time I came of lids but came in recently and ordered coffee; The results no spills what so ever, Whoo hooh!!!!

I have to say that was the reason I would not come in as often as I am in the neighborhood due to the fact of spilling with your previous lids. The lids you have now Rock no spills or mess when sipping  your hot and fresh coffee.

Now I can go to my local Peet's for your oh so delicious yet not bitter or flavorless coffee.  I thank you and yes I will come again. I will be closely watching the lid situation and update accordingly.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I work at a cafe nearly everyday, and if you need to work, keep walking, because unfortunately they only give you one hour on their wi-fi at Peet's and it's really annoying to log in. They require passcodes that are printed on a receipt and you have to ask for when you pay. Sometimes you have to ask for another passcode, because it won't work. And if you have two devices, forget it. Only one passcode per device. 

They have good tea. Order the Rare. But one time I ordered it and they gave me a tiny pot with a giant coffee mug to pour it into. Are you kidding? Peet's offers tea & coffee tastings, so I imagine their employees will eventually get it right in the tea area, since they are targeting an audience who wants to learn about tea or already knows about tea. Can't wait, because it is pretty decent tea for a commercial cafe. 

Not a place for romance. Pure business here, unless you're newly in love (in that case ANY PLACE can be romantic!) and you don't want to whisper sweet nothings, because it's bustling and loud.

Bathroom is clean and there is ample sitting. Nice light at the front.
author: Jessica S.

description: This place is less crowded than Starbucks and their coffee isn't watered down.  Unless i'm looking for a dirty chai latte (the one thing starbucks, unfortunately does better) I'm going here.
author: Mike V.

description: I'm a fan of Peet's. The coffee is excellent, and strong. Just the love the aroma. The staff are really helpful and friendly, especially Erik. He makes the best espresso around. I love going here early in the morning.
author: Harle Q.

description: Peet's is just not as good as it used to be. Maybe this is due to the fact that I have tried Philz, but Peet's just doesn't taste the same. Parking kind of sucks, unless you come here early in the morning. There's not much seating; not much of a place to come and study for a little, but, perhaps, it's supposed to be that way. On the upside, the coffee is still way better than Starbucks, the employees at this location are super nice, and I like this location because it's easy for me to get here by bus or by car. For those three reasons I gave Peet's Coffee and Tea at West Portal 3 stars.
author: Lauren D.

description: I don't understand why the summer drink I got was hot and not a cold frapp. Disappointed because I was expecting to cool down with a cold drink but instead got a HOT drink when I was burning up. The drink tasted fine but I just didn't like how they made it wrong.
author: Carmen L.

description: This is a neat little spot to be while waiting to be seated for dinner at the Mexican Restaurant next door. Last week, I had the new green tea late drink. I ask for it cold. It was delicious, like having a drink of green tea ice cream. Yummy! I then tried the new coconut café late. That was okay. Yet for me I enjoyed the green tea drink much better.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Grabbed a mocha and some pastries here and was happily satisfied with my purchases. I requested my mocha to not be too sweet and it was made perfectly. The barista poured the milk in right in front of me and after one sip I was in coffee heaven. Espresso pulled perfectly and I left with a smile on my face :) This was yet another example of why I love Peet's :)
author: Brittany J.

description:
Thanks to Peet's - West Portal for getting me through a semester's worth of 9am-12n Child Development classes. I enjoy very strong, rich, and dark coffee. Straight...no cream, no sugar. Coffee that stimulates all the senses.

I keep coming back...and my grades are better for it. hehe
author: Michael G.

description:
I like Peet's coffee much more than Starbucks but sadly, this location closes at 8pm. Sadly, that is often too early for me to buy a cup to go on my way to work. The seating is extremely limited as well. I got real excited when I saw them remodeling awhile back. I assumed they would put in more space for tables and chairs. But alas, I was mistaken.
 I hope one day they figure out the potential for being open later and offering more seating. I would like very much to spend the time I spend at Starbucks up the road at this Peet's
author: Miss Kae O.

description:
So I'm originally from SJ but I came here last night with my bf because we were going to go out with some friends of ours... He decided that we should go to this Peet's coffee just to kill some time....

I ordered the sugar-free chocolate mocha and my boyfriend ordered the caramel freddo! And in a matter of minutes our drinks were done! I sprinkled some cinnamon into my mocha and it tasted oh so delicious :) the caramel freddo tasted like a caramel milkshake, yummerz. Our drinks were soo good, OMG. My mocha tasted like mocha and you couldn't really taste the sugar-free syrup which was good! And the caramel freddo that my bf ordered was super creamy and not too sugary which was awesome!

The staff was friendly and comical so that's always a plus! The size of this Peet's is big and plus there's outdoor seating as well. I think it was the perfect night to go get some coffee because the weather was just right and our drinks were awesome. No complaining whatsoever. :D 

I would definitely come back to this Peet's whenever I'm in the neighborhood!!!! Oh and I definitely want to try some of the Italian restaurants that are located here... They seem really good!!!

Happy Eating.
author: Frannie H.

description:
I typically only get black coffee @ Coffee shops.

Peets coffee is potent and delicious - robust flavor and it does the trick. Plus it originated in Berkley! Bay AREAAAA

Peets over Starbucks any day.
author: Phil H.

description:
I like a lot of things, but not this place.
Their coffee tastes like monkey poo in water.
It's sometimes over $5 for a MEDIUM specialty drink.
They make Starbucks look like Dollar Tree.
And Sbux coffee is better!
Also, no seats at this location.
Idiotic, "wifi code" system. (2 hrs max)
Walk a little more, burn a few calories and save money.
Go to Starbucks down the street or Noah's Bagels UP the street.
Much better, cheaper coffee and real seats!
author: Dadasd d.

description:
"Starbucks or Peet's?" my friend asked.  Normally I do not review chain coffee places, but he got me riled up.

The first thing that popped up in my mind was a memorable dialogue from Crimson Tide, starring Denzel Washington, who played Hunter.

--------------

Hunter: It better not happen again. If I see this kind of nonsense again, I'm going to write you up. You understand? Do you understand?

Rivetti: Yes, Sir.

Hunter: You have to set an example even in the face of stupidity. Everybody who reads comic books knows that the Kirby Silver Surfer is the only true Silver Surfer. Now am I right or wrong?

Rivetti: You're right, Sir.

Hunter: Now get out of here.

Rivetti: Yes, Sir.

------------ 

Who wins the taste test for a robust coffee?  Not that I am a coffee snob, but I love Peet's Italian Roast.  

As an in-and-out store, I have never taken advantage of their free wi-fi.
Besides, there are not many tables and seating.  

Regardless, you shall find their service to be super friendly.  Staff knows their coffee and tea.  No question is stupid unless you do not ask.

If you are a tea drinker, Peet's Golden Dragon Oolong Tea is divine.
