author: CT L.

description:
The staff is friendly. I like. :) Their coffee is also really good... Stronger than Starbucks. A little more expensive than Starbucks, but this isn't a post comparing and contrasting.. lol.
It's relatively really clean, which is great. I like clean stores. :)V
author: Susan Y.

description:
we stood at the counter while 3-4 of the staff fiddled around with the espresso machine and mop.  while they could work on their service, their coffee is still the strongest if you're looking for a cup of joe to wake you up.  

if you like to buy your own coffee beans and make coffee at home, they're having a special: if you buy a pound of blue sumatra, you get a free medium raspberry mocha.
author: Carli F.

description:
I really like Peet's, definitely not one of my FAVORITE ones, but it has a special place in my heart.  Sometimes I'll get off the train at West Portal, walk down two blocks, get my small vanilla latte, walk back up the street, stop at Noah's, and then walk back to West Portal to wait for the train to go to school.  

It's not my daily routine, because usually I cannot wait that long for my morning coffee.  

It's kind of annoying that there is not enough seating on the inside.  Or outside for that manner...

but the employees here are always very friendly to me, cheerful enough at 8 am in the morning...and don't mess with me once they see the half-dead/half-awake/give-me-my-goddamn-coffee look on my face.
author: Marley E.

description:
Free Wi-Fi has come to Peet's!  You feelin' me? 

The drawback is that there's not many tables/chairs at this location, although outdoor seating is available.
author: Teddy B.

description:
I've actually never been to this Peet's, but I am cheating and giving them 5 stars solely on the basis of their karaoke performances. I have seen the employees of this Peet's go to The Mint twice now and as a karaoke regular, I typically hate parties and groups but Peet's West Portal defies the stereotype of annoying group sings (it never works out, people, MAN UP and sing by yourself) and picking songs you think you know, but actually don't. Yes, I'm looking at you, assholes who pick "Baby Got Back", "The Humpty Dance", and "Bohemian Rhapsody" and are then shocked to find out that the song has actual lyrics. 

Extra stars for Victor, who I'm hoping is a manager here, because anyone who can sing "Eye of The Tiger" and "When Doves Cry" and manage to KILL at both of them, deserves to be in charge of something.
author: Maria D.

description:
Why would anyone go to Starbucks when there's a Peet's nearby?  

Hmmm...let's see, I can have a watery, lukewarm sorry excuse for a cup of coffee, OR...I can have the rich and creamy, hot and always perfect cup of Peet's Coffee.

Yeah, Peet's wins EVERY time.  This location is really a quick in and out joint.  They always make my coffee perfect!

I love you Peet's!!
author: Christy L.

description:
Saturday a.m., a line 30 people long, a bitchass yapping boyfriend waiting outside with a bitchass yapping (yet beautiful and charming) mini Dachshund. the 2-legged animal is fortunate he didn't wind up with a face and crotch splashed with piping hot joe. I had done starfuck's for years until I tried Peet's in '98. God what an epiphany that was ! compared to Peet's drip coffee, starfuck's tasted like it belonged in a baby's bottle. I drink mine black, it gets the motor going quicker than crack (just an allegory, I don't do substances). their mocha is nice but the latte is milky potent love in a 20-oz cup.

before rejoining the bitchass yappy twins outside, I pick up a couple of the most sinfully good NONFAT pumpkin ginger muffins, each bigger than a size C implant, bursting with indescribable delight. also try the oat and fruit bars, soooooooooo effing delicious ! if I didn't give a damn anymore I would eat 6 of them
author: Prima D.

description:
I go on weekdays, and even when there's a line, I get my tea/coffee fairly quickly and it's also well-made.

I love the location and its outdoor tables on sunny days.  Great for people/dog watching while getting some reading done.
author: Min H.

description:
PEET'S DRINKERS ANONYMOUS  (P.D.A.)  MEETING:

My name is Jon F. 

"Hi Jon F."

And I'm a Peetnik.  My last Peet's drink was 14 hours ago.  I cannot control myself.  My life sucks and I just know if I have one sip of that Soy Vanilla Latte all my problems will go away. Now I have no money, my girlfriend who works at Starbucks down the street left me, and three workers know I wear a disguise and give a fake name everytime I go in there.  

I knew it was a problem when I would buy the Major Dickinson Blend and drink the grind straight (Filter:4), and still get a chance to get a free coffee.. (tsk tsk..sigh)

But life is getting better. I go to church.  Guess what? I have a sponsor who I call when I have the urge and have hallucinations of pink elephants, adult size penguins or when the Peet's cup is talking to me from the SOLO lid mouth.  My sponsor (ironically named Pete) says I'm still in the first stage: Admit that I am a Peetnik.  I can't fake it anymore. I know that now.  

(everyone applauses)
_________________________________________________
Anyways, their coffee gets me high on a sunny day.  Why was I so naive to drink Starbucks all these past years?  Habitual Peet's drinker for almost a year, I now laugh at people walking down the streets of West Portal with a Starbucks and say in my mind "What a coffee noob (newbie)!"   

Me and Peet's BFF!
author: Jon F.

description:
I heart Peet's, but this one isn't really conducive for meeting someone for coffee.  Not a lot of tables and barely enough room for 2.  Add in that woman sitting on the bench screaming into her iPhone like it's her own personal office - really?!?

I'll go back but not to meet and hang out.
author: Mabelle A.

description:
This is the birthplace of my longest running addiction. I grew up in this neighborhood and it's rich, strong coffee helped me get through high school. (D+!? YESSS!! THANKS PEET'S!!) 

They should really add a drip drain because for years there was a little sign that said "Please do not pour coffee in garbage can," which was only effective at making me feel guilty about pouring coffee in the garbage can.

Great coffee and great beans. DEATH TO STARBUCKS!
author: Josua P.

description:
I don't dislike here. I love classic music Peets play in general and outside seating.

The problem here is they do not care about customer's need. WiHI signal has been dropped for days.  They knew it. Still, they don't attempt to do anything to recover it. In general, looks like Peets don't like Laptop people.  That's fine, I don' t care, I just  go to Starbucks one block ahead,  but if so, don't advertise that we are happy to provide WIHI please. 

Another thing is staff can have more smile. Some staff are looks-like medicated or sick faces. Coffee needs friendly and nice smile. I don't care about coffee taste, I care about human touch.
author: AI T.

description:
I dearly love Peet's, as a local institution and as a purveyor of excellent coffee. This particular location gets knocked one star for their annoying lack of a drip grate. If you don't want me to pour it in the garbage, you should probably install one of those drip drains pretty soon, because I'm sure not going to go back up to the counter every time and either hold up the line or worse, wait in it, for a disgruntled employee to angrily demand "how much?" As if I'm insulting their handiwork in pouring the coffee in the first place. I just want some room for (soy) cream, okay? It shouldn't be that big of a deal. And don't even try to ask these girls for special requests like soy milk or sugar-free vanilla syrup. It may happen grudgingly, but it probably won't be right anyhow. 

Most of the stars remain intact, because it's still a Peet's, with all the goodies that go along with that (minus the drip drain) and the people-watching here is priceless.
author: Megan W.

description:
I would say this is a great Starbucks alternative with their stronger coffee, but hey, it's another chain, and one thing that really pisses me off about this Peets is its lack of quality seating.  You see, you don't just go to a coffee shop to get your caffeine fix, but a lot of times you want a place to chill, maybe read the paper or have relaxing conversation with a friend.

Starbucks, just down the street, is unfortunately more inviting and lets in a lot more afternoon sunshine to go with your vanilla latte.  And while they have two smallish tables outside, because the storefront and the sidewalk aren't very wide, they're a bit cramped and don't give you ample room, to say, pull out some cigarettes without imposing your carcinogens on patrons and passerbyers alike.
author: Tony L.

description:
Peet's Coffee on an Easter Sunday morning... I know what you're going to say, that's some hardcore addiction! Funny part about that is I quit drinking coffee over ten years ago. Now, it's all green tea and chai lattes. And an unhealthy share of muffins and scones. The sugar's what makes up for the lack of caffeine.

Peet's Coffee on an Easter Sunday morning... Great time for me to get some quality quiet time, or so I thought. People should really be limited to one cup of Joe before 8:00am on an Easter Sunday morning! Too many people trying to share too much information with me that I don't want anything to know about! 

Peet's Coffee on an Easter Sunday morning... You would've gotten 5 stars for providing me with a good chai latte early on a holiday morning, but I didn't get to sit and enjoy it without being harrassed by the over-caffinated masses scurrying around your coffee house.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
Best coffee on the block. This is what coffee should be like, strong, smooth and hot. Awesome strong lattes with great foam on the top.  Why is it so hard for Starbucks to make a hot cup o' joe?

Yes, the line can be long, but that's just all the people with good taste waiting for their coffee. Pastries go quick at this location, but the cinnamon twist and apple pastry are good. And for a chocolate rush, the chocolate truffle cookie is to die for.
author: Maria M.

description:
Starbucks, you just got owned!!

I've only recently started drinking lattes, caramel macchiatos and white mochas.  All courtesy of the Starbucks near my work.

On my first visit to Peet's, I've realized what I have been missing from all these visits to Starbucks... that's a good cup of joe!

Yes, the padawan has finally grown up.

Time to join the rebellion and take down the Starbuck's Empire.
author: Sam T.

description:
Hands down my favorite Peet's.
Lemon Rose iced tea with a little bit Simple syrup. 
Seating is limited but today, I found a seat outside in this very rare 80 degree weather and people watched (In a non creepy way).
author: Shereen R.

description: I love this place, and all the people that work there besides 1, I am a every day customer! I walk in this morning to the shop 6:00am as soon as i walk in i get harassed by a bum off the streets inside the store asking me for money and to buy him coffee gets mad when i say no and tell him to leave, He start verbally cursing an looking to get into a fight i step back an protect my self. "Cindy LUTZ" at the end Runs out an say that i was the problem when she was in the back an did not see a thing, She needs to look back at the cameras!!!! An listen to a everyday paying customer. I wont be going back any more thanks to CINDY LUTZ!!
author: Adrian B.

description:
Okay, I think it's definitely about time to give my second home the title of being the best of the best. Yeah, yeah, yeah, I concur - their sweet drinks can be a bit sweeter but really, just listen.

I wanted to order my regular tall sugar-free vanilla latte extra hot along with a watter bottle today & I assumed that the water bottle was $1. Wrong, it was $2 but I didn't realize that until I got to the counter and was greeted by my usual barista. I was short one dollar. Instead of making me pay the $4.20 that I had, she told me to give he the $2 for the water bottle and that was it. I paid $2 for coffee AND my watter bottle. Dear Lord, a very merry christmas to these folks!
author: Steph W.

description:
This is the S  l    o    w e s t Peet's I've been to.
I am basing this on at least 5 visits, never during morning rush.
All visits have been at average times throughout the day, with differing amounts of customers.
They (the employees) just have NO thought for you, and that maybe you just want to get your latte and go. I have been amazed, really, at the lengths I've waited. And, I would say maybe it's jinxed bad luck, like how I always pick the wrong line at the grocery store. But the slowness has happened too many times. Stores have a style, and a culture, and this one just beats to a slower drum.
(Never had a bad drink there.)
author: Vale C.

description: Okay, I usually get my coffee from that "other" coffee house a block away, but recently started getting my coffee at Peets.  I have to say, they make good coffee.  They're Americanos are smooth. I think I've have a new place to get my coffee.
author: Jennifer M.

description: I am not this Peet's Coffee. I am Fillmore St., California St., or other. I came in town for a haircut. I knew better than to drink low fat milk with a Freddo, I forgot to request whole milk. A homeless man wants my seat outside, so I get kicked out. Ah, hmmm, looks like they got their regulars that they know. I came in at like noon, came in later with like 9 inches of hair cut off and no one noticed, that's how customer service they are. Although it is Halloween, I think they were in the middle of changing shifts before I got my hair cut. Any way, take to go if you can, be sure to specify if you need anything special and unless you are a regular, or homeless, don't expect love unless you give it. I gave them a great goodbye and happy Halloween. Also does this Peet's even have a bathroom? I mean I hear complaints about dirty bathrooms, what about no bathroom?
author: Lisa L.

description: Use to love to this location! but since people's keep change~ my favor drink become watery and nasty now~ I am sorry! I been giving chances but... I spend like $5 for a small drink~ and sometime taste like sugar water and something taste like there are no coffee taste! I don't think I will come back to this location =(
author: Joyce W.

description: I love Peets, but this location is just too small for the volume of customers. There is never a seat . The turn over is high and  always crowded. I find the staff have no time to clean the tables or counters, before another customer sits down. I hope Peets will find a bigger location in the neighborhood.
author: Linda A.

description:
I'm completely addicted to peet's coffee (actually the iced lattes). But the west portal one is by far my fave branch. I love going here when I have a lot of reading or school work to do. When San Francisco actually has a sunny day, its great to sit outside. Why bother driving here? Youre right next to the west portal muni station.
Plus pretty much everyone that works there is super friendly, and I'm sure that more then half the staff know what I like to drink. (Considering I've been going there for at least two years now.) Which I can always appreciate.
author: Pearl M.

description: The people that work in this location are super nice and friendly and they seem to do a great job even when the line fills the entire shop. The coffee is always consistent as well, not like the hershey squirt in a cup you get from Starbucks.
author: Scott B.

description: Was never a big fan of Peet's, but received a pound of their holiday blend for Christmas and thought I'd try it again.  Turns out they don't grind their coffee after it leaves the store.  Why would anyone but it as a gift then?  Yes, the bag was still sealed.  I was asked whether I had a grinder at home.  If I had one doesn't it stand to reason that I would have used it?  Then I was asked if I couldn't ask a friend.  Why?  I expect that you should grind your own.  Funny thing, I went to Tully's and they did it.  Why not, talk about customer service.  Also, the male that waited on me was rude and quite condesending.  When I said that I was going to YELP Peet's he said that I should do whatever...Sp I did!
author: Barbra H.

description: As a Seattle native, I was tempted to maintain a Starbucks loyalty after moving here.  But when I discovered that Peet's originated in Berkeley, I made the switch, and now I'm on a mission to go to every (stand-alone) Peet's in the city.  So far I've only made it to this one--the one within walking distance.  Coffee tasted great to me, but I seriously am no expert on that sort of thing.
author: Wes M.

description:
Peets is to Starbucks what the Prius is to the Hummer - 

You get exponentially more bang for your buck, and a lovely glow of moral superiority that lasts all day.

Real people drink real coffee.

Leave the $6.00 super double venti mocha-frappe-whippa-loofa-cola for the posers and tourists.
author: Anna H.

description:
I've been a Starbucks addict for many years now. Partly because I did like the taste of their lattes, partly because I used to have a great hookup back east (e.g. hot baristas serving me quad white mochas for pennies on the dollar), and partly because  Starbucks is just freaking everywhere (http://www.gergltd.com/users/isaac.gerg/starbucks/).

I tried Peet's regular coffee for the first time a few years ago while in Sacramento on business. I didn't even drink half of it because I thought it tasted horrible. Maybe it was a bad bean, maybe I hit a bad location, maybe the staff was having a really tough day at it . . . I don't know. Fast forward a few years to 2006 and I find myself enjoying Peet's Arabian Mocha Java at home almost daily. And on days when I go to refill I also pickup a large latte at a discount. Come on, a place that realizes they are overcharging you for coffee and offers you a discount as a result . . . that's high quality.
author: Todd F.

description:
Now *this* is a good cup of coffee...

I miss West Portal Peet's... with a Noahs.

*sigh*
author: christy c.

description:
Their strong soy lattes save me from drooling in class. This is strong coffee..straight up.  But the pumpkin latte and peppermint mocha were nasty to say the least. Peet's is definitely for a more mature, stronger coffee crowd whereas Starbucks appeals to a younger crowd and is good if you like mixed drinks on the sweeter side. (hot chocolate, mochas, frapps..)  

Nonetheless, workers here are super friendly---memorizing your name and usual order while striking up nice conversations is always a plus.
author: Alexa M.

description: I stop by here on occasion when I'm getting my Noah's Bagel fix and grab their matcha green tea frozen drink which is pretty good. I also like their coffee a little more than Starbucks because it just tastes stronger when I need the caffeine in the morning.
author: Petra S.

description: Depending on the staff member that helps you out, the experience can be a hit or miss. Luckily, I've had more experiences with happy than grumpy staff. My most recent visit was great - the gal even gave me a sampler of the Sumatra Blue Batak benas to try at home. Every so often they have coffee tastings too.
author: Judy L.

description:
Um, I like Starbucks better and I know it feeds into the corporate greed.  I just wasn't feeling it here.

3 tables inside and 3 tables outside.  Where am I supposed to sit and enjoy my coffee and magazine?  

I ordered an iced tea.  They didn't have any tea so they had to make it.  That took 8 minutes I kid you not.  Then when it was brewed they put it in a canister thing and forgot about me until 3 minutes later I went up to the counter and asked.  

When I did get my iced tea finally, it barely had any ice in it.  

Just an overall disappointment.  Maybe I am too partial to Starbucks and maybe it was an off day.  :)  But for now I'm sticking with my Starbucks, it just works for me.
author: Denise B.

description: Me & my wife stop here every morning on our way to work and on weekends too. Georgia makes the coffee on weekdays and is consistently good!
author: Anuj A.

description:
I'm a big fan of Peet's, both for the quality and variety of coffee and teas. This location is not the best to sit down, read newspaper/magazines (though I have done this occasionally), or lounge about. Instead, the location is a quick stop and go with little hassle. I highly recommend visiting the Peet's on Clement if you'd like the more easy going atmosphere. 

Employees are great. I frequent the West Portal location almost everyday around the same time, so it's great to see familiar faces.
author: Teresa Y.

description:
The good: Fast, Friendly, and Reasonably priced for coffee today. Love their organic scones although I'm tring to cut back on carbs.

The bad: I got kind of rude response once regarding whipped cream. Me "can I have whipped cream on my freddo?" Barista -"just to let you know whipped cream doesn't come with freddos, if you wanted it you should've asked". Me thinking"wtf just give me my damn whipped cream, it's a little fluffy thing that goes on top of my treat!". 

5 stars for bringing a hihger quality coffee other than starbucks to change it up a bit. Minus one for the rude whipped cream comment.
author: Keit K.

description: We go here every weekend. Seriously, every single weekend and frequently weekdays. Better to walk or take MUNI unless you want to double-park your car in the annoying line of SUVs that forms in the middle of the street. It is a bustling, warm, cheerful shop. The baristas mostly have a sense of humor. They don't make cute designs in the foam and they aren't weird in that truly-SF-local way, but they're friendly and competent and produce good, dark, rich flavors. It's not a place to conduct serious business, true, but it's a pretty fun place to people watch and sit for 15 minutes sipping coffee out on the sidewalk before you go get your Noah's bagel or your Squat and Gobble omelet or your Submarine Sandwich pastrami. This is a coffeeshop that genuinely services its caffeine-seeking yuppie neighborhood.
author: p v.

description: I go to a coffee shop at least once a day, and I have taken a particular liking to this location because it has a wonderful-independant coffee shop- feel, but with the excellent and reliable coffee of peets. I love the seats out on the sidewalk-- truly the best place for a relaxing moment... and you just don't know who you might run into being out in the open like that!
author: James P.

description: Peet's makes pretty damn good coffee.  No hippies holding the line up by smoking bowls and taking twenty minutes learning to use the Italian gizmo that cranks out espressos. This here is a bonified greased wheel mark-of-efficiency operation.Get my $2.50 cap here almost everyday and once in awhile I'm lucky enough to get served by the live action version of the baby sitter bandit, Ms. Botz.
author: Phil M.

description: I'm pretty easy going when it comes to my coffee shops. Usually I can always find something to bring me back, but what I can't take is an obnoxious employee. Which  is, unfortunately, what you'll find here. Most of the other workers seemed nice enough, but there's this one girl with glasses and darker skin who insists on talking over customers if they have questions about the food or wifi connection--which might be excusable if she were answering those questions, but she's more likely to change the subject. Trying to approach another barista for help, whether about coffee recomendations, prices, or why the wifi shut down after five minutes of use, only resulted in her abandoning a newer customer to launch herself into the conversation. I don't know if she's trying to show she cares by that or what, but I think I'll go to the West Portal Starbucks next time...
author: Anna J.

description: I love Peet's. But then I usually frequent the one at Potrero Shopping Center where the staff is nice and the service is fast. Today my husband and I went to the West Portal location and as we stepped through the door we must've accidentally become enmeshed in Harry Potter's cloak of invisibility. There were four people behind the counter, no customers in the store. We stepped right up ready to hand over our cash for a nice mocha and pastry. But to our astonishment no one acknowledged us or met our eyes. they just continued to talked to one another and fiddle faddled behind the counter. We stupidly stood there for literally three minutes before marching out. I don't know what that was all about but we will never be going back to that Peet's again.
author: Kara P.

description: Yes it's a chain. Regardless of the fact this place it great.  It is clean. Fast. And everyone is super friendly. A long time ago I worked at a Peet's in Novato. What I love about it most is they still have the same standards they did ten years ago. Every time I go I get a great non fat chai steamed to perfection!
author: Wes P.

description: Peet's Coffee is so good, when it went corporate it shoulda' been a 501c3.
author: Kimberley M.

description: I love the size of this peet's, and the location is incredible for me. They make coffee super quick too which is nice. I don't always get a perfect latte at this peets but like everyone else has said starbucks isn't even comparable! I think i'll love peets forever though, its the best tasting coffee my lips have tasted.
author: Ali S.

description: The atmosphere is warm and friendly. There are several baristas working together helping get the orders out the door. There is free WiFi; however, you must remember to ask the barista for a 2 hour code while ordering your Coffee.
author: Rev M.

description: Hmm.. I think they try too hard to be like Starbucks. They have this drink called a Chai Freddo. I asked what it was, and the cashier said, "Like a Frappucino." Poor Peet's. I don't drink coffee, so I can only speak for the Chai Freddo. It wasn't nearly as yummy as Starbucks' chai creme frappucino.. and not enough whipped cream!
author: O K.

description: West Portal deserve the best Peets in town, no?  Consider our typical days filled with excessive fog, rain, brisk wind, etc., and it's pretty damned clear we live in a part of the world that needs good coffee, and plenty of it.  Strong enough to peel the paint on my car, and hot enough to scald me 20 minutes after I walk out the door, that's not just what I want out here in fogland, it's what I need.  More now!
author: Hugh B.

description:
It's 8am. The head is pounding. Doing the walk of shame. There's only one place that I'm Jonesing for: Peets on the Westsiiiiiiiide of the Portal. Had some of that Anniversary Blend again, a double dose this time...and then hit hyper-drive with Coffee Convo: thoughts and conversation motivated by a Peets overdose.  I usually take my coffee and sit outside to watch all the AM action in West Portal before heading to work. Mostly delivery trucks, locals and freaky dogs tied to parking meters. Outside Dude says to me, "Peet's is approaching a mid-life crisis being 40 and all." I bust out with, "Unless 40 is the new 30, which is the new 20 which is, well I'm sure there's an exponential math formula in there somewhere." Outside Dude, "It's kind of like that new show Lost?" Caffeinated Me: "Um how so? And Lost isn't that new." OD: "There are unsolved problems that are beyond human ability or comprehension to solve, with our only hope being to interact and understand. And Lost is newer than Scrubs." I busted out with, "Woh! Heavy!" He drinks, "I mean we're all lost." I'm thinking, "Outside Dude is lost" and ask, "You talkin'  'all the world's a stage stuff?'" Outside Dude looks at me and puffs his cig and drinks his coffee, "Sort of..but not, I'm just riffing on your math comment." I come to my senses realizing that I've just had a fully fueled conversation about NOTHING, and that if I keep doing this with Outside Dude, I really will be lost, not to mention late for work. Retreated for another cup and was relieved to find that OD found a new partner to talk to: a pigeon. 

4 duckets for the coffee being extra strong, 1 extra ducket for Fiona serving it up with some good 'tude.
author: Johnny C.

description: I love this specific Peet's coffee shop because it is never usually loud, but quiet and cozy.  Because Peet's coffee is known to be strong, older individuals are usually here, making the shop cozy and comfortable.  The only negative thing about that is that there are not very many seats and tables, but, the yummy coffee and pasteries make up for that!
author: Lisa H.

description: better and fresher coffee than Starbuck's. also serves gourmet local  Artisan pastries. why bother with the other guys if Peet's is on the block?
author: Jeff W.

description: If I had a bullhorn, I'd hold it up to your ear and yell: BEST DAMN COFFEE IN THE WORLD!
author: L. M.

description: I love their sugar free banana chocolate with red stuff on it.  yum yum...!!!  We don't need to talk about their coffee, because it is definitely better than starbucks.
author: Albert W.

description: In my opinion, best place to get coffee on WP.  The coffee is rich, flavorful and satisfying.  And if you are thinking about getting a pastry, the cinnamon twist is wonderfully delightful.  On a warm, sunny afternoon, there is nothing more enjoyable than sitting down outside of Peets on WP with your cup of coffee or tea and people watching.  I am sure you will not be disappointed!
author: Micaela M.

description:
I love Peets.  Their coffee is great...especially their iced coffee.  I hate Starbucks because their coffee just tastes awful.  I mean - their regular coffee - not the stuff that has a cup of sugar and a cup of cream.  

Other points
1. they have a lot of new people which is really hard on everyone...but they're doing their darnest
2. they try hard to make sure you leave happy (A for effort!)
3.  A lot of people in the neighborhood hang out there - which is good (yay! neighborhood) or bad (boo - no seats)
4.  I really wish that they'd extend their hours - Starbucks is half a block away and they are open a lot earlier and close much later - all the cops hang out there.  I have to go into Starbucks and grumble grumble grumble about the crap coffee (it tastes burnt!) and then the cops remember my face and think - don't say that about my favorite West Portal hang out! and i'm sure they will not be forgiving when they pull me over for, i dunno, weaving around all the tards who don't know how to look for parking on West Portal. On that note - why do people all suddenly forget how to drive when they get on West Portal?

whew!  

in conclusion....Peets = delicious
author: Rose Z.

description: This is more of a to-go Peet's, there's not a lot of seating, so I like to walk my dog here in the mornings. There's nothing out of the ordinary about this coffee shop compared to others, but on West Portal I prefer this to Starbucks. They are generally pretty fast and I don't have to worry about the prices being raised every month or two!
author: Kristin D.

description: This is one of the best Peet's.  Friendly, good flow of set up.  Chairs outside.  Just great!
author: K W.

description: my morning stop.  good coffee good service.  i go there so often that i get alot of  gratis coffee. really cool people. sumatra roast is top notgh.
author: brian l.

description: Good Coffee, wierd employees, and good coffee. Did I just say that? Like them dark and strong....
author: Stanley K.

description: I panicked coming to this Peet's because I couldn't see the sign any more!  "OH NO," I thought, "I'll have to get coffee at Starbucks!" (which is the next block over).  But, luckily, it's just that the tree in front of Peet's grew too big and is covering the signage.  WHEW!  If on that side of SF, we swing by and sit for a while to people-watch and to play with the dogs.  Nice way to spend a half hour before we're off to the next activity.
author: Patty W.

description: I can always get coffee here and I can still taste the coffee... Only thing that is keeping me from adding a fifth star is that there is none near the daly city / south san francisco area.  Overall, great coffee..
author: Trish P.

description:
Problem with this place is with some of the baristas' bad attitudes.
They think their place is as chic as Starbucks, but that is simply untrue.
Prices and coffee-choices just about the same at each.
This particular Peets place had some loudmouthed Brit guy barista yak away about his various travels together with another sycophantic haut-attitude WASPy gal barista going all along with him.  Of course they both complained about the nice gentle music playing in their store just around lunchtime when I visited.  Guess that these two are going out or engaged or something based upon their behavior around customers...really now!

During lunchtime, the Brit-dude and WASP gal barista duo were just too hyper-kinetic for comfort.  Maybe they both should have laid off their fifth or sixth noontime double-expresso's on-the-house ya think??? Cigarette smoke just HAD to stream inside from one or two persons puffing away on their cancer-sticks just outside the door, and some poor guy had to use tablespace near the front of the store for his laptop WiFi.  Amusing was that this WiFi guy had to reach ALL the way up to the ceiling's electrical outlets to power on his computer -- he actually had NO other choice as far as supplied power.  Can you say TRES AWKWARD ??? (I just did!)

Poor overall baristas' attitudes towards towards customers and terrible store design leave me with a low impression of this particular Peets store, and'll just encourage me to visit The Greenhouse next time in the area.  A West Portal branch of The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf anyone ?? 
dw
author: David W.

description: By far one of my favorite coffee spots...Sorry starbuck lovers....I hate starbucks...!!! Nice good brewed coffee...Workers there are laid back and very friendly...Good ambiance, good neighborhood and good people! What else can you want!
author: bo y.

description: If anyone knows of a Peets' location that can make a soy latte in under 4 minutes(and I was timing him) when no one else is in line, Please please let me know....
author: L K.

description: Why does their chai tea latte taste like laundry detergent? Why?
author: Leah E.

description: Let me start off by saying that I am not a coffee drinker. When I do drink coffee, it's decaf, which my bf says is fake coffee(he gets quad shots! Crazy, huh?) When I usually hit up a coffee place I usually get a hot chocolate or when I need it, a decaf mocha. Hey, they say that decaf has a little caffeine in it. All I have to say is that the hot chocolate here sucks. When I order it , it taste like plain milk that is just chocolate colored, not chocolate flavored. I mean obviously when someone orders a hot chocolate over a hot cup of coffee, it's because they want something sweet. Nope, I do not get that here. I'm not even sure how the barrista got the milk chocolate colored without it even being chocolate flavored, I guess she didn't put enough chocolate syrup/powder (not even sure which one they use) in it? The last time the bf and I came here, he ordered his coffee and was enjoying it all the way down to the bottom and when he got to the bottom he had a whole mouthful of coffee grounds. YUCK! What a disappointment to a good cup of coffee. Oh, and whats up with the coffee cups being messy. We always get handed our drinks with coffee spills all along the side. Those messy barristas. The service here is slow and not friendly at all. I swear the last time I came here the bf and I ordered our drinks and like the different people that were behind us in line got their drinks before us and there was only one barrista making the coffee. What's up with that? Why do you ask do we keep coming back? We have a friend who is a a coffee snob and only likes Peet's coffee and I don't really thinks he cares about the service. So, every time we are out with him he only wants to go to our local Peet's. Don't you think half of the whole experience of going to your local coffee place is for the barristas/service? Now I will just go there with the bf and friend and just not order anything. For the service and the bad tasting hot chocolate, I can just go home and make a better hot chocolate.
author: carebear l.

description: Came here on a freezing cold day to get some hot chocolates while the kids were at West Portal Playground for practice.  I ordered 2 kids hot chocolates and 1 small (regular size) hot chocolate.  When I got the drinks, I'd have to say that the kids hot chocolates were about 1/4 cup full with hot chocolate and another 1/4 of it was filled with whipped cream on top making the cup 1/2 full.  My regular size hot chocolate was about 1/2 filled with hot chocolate and 1/4 filled with whipped cream.  Kids took two sips each and they were finished.  What a rip off.  To top it off, it didn't even taste like hot chocolate!!  Tasted like water with a hint of cocoa flavoring!  Total rip off.  Economy is bad but this is ridiculous!  Never again will I go to this Pete's Coffee!
author: Suzy W.

description: narrow space makes customer interaction prettty highly likely.  the staff is very friendly.  and when they ground our pound of coffee the wrong coarseness we found out they DONATE the mistakes instead of just tossing them  A+ on that alone.
author: ed h.

description: what a disappointment! i love the coffee but i highly dislike the establishment. i cant pinpoint the issue for sure but this place is filled with weird people, including myself.
author: papa c.

description: Great Service, Awesome coffee. however i don't like the idea of unleashed pets in the store or pet's in general. Otherwise excelent service very fast. great job everyone thanks
author: szsurge t.

description: The tall AA male Barista messed up my order after having made the same mistake for the previous customer. (Not a good sign!) I was crossing the street when I realized he missed the shot of Vanilla but I just couldn't be bothered going back. PEETS is usually pretty reliable but for $4 coffee the quality has to be consistently high and unfortunately on this visit it was disappointing.
author: David W.

description: Peets has turned into a predatory animal, running over mom and pop shops.  It's happened in Palo Alto, and now it's happening in Half Moon Bay.  I believe in free market, but this is a different story: They seek out a successful coffee shop, and then wrestle it away.  They effectively steal the business goodwill and customer base.  Peets is now on my boycott list.
author: Oliver K.

description: addicted to their ice large non fat sugar-free vanila lite on the ice late. since im very picky regarding my drink, i have to checked on my ice twice.. but they are overall nice and even though the line can be pretty long but usually they got my order fast and right ! yippy..
author: sherly A.
